  • java.lang.Object

      • getGlobalMaxHD

        public int getGlobalMaxHD(int index1,
                 int index2)

        returns the maximum trace intensity over an index range.

        This is for Heteroduplex traces only and does not include the size standard channel.
        Parameters:
        index1 - the start index of the range
        index2 - the end index of the range
        Returns:
        the max trace intensity

      • loadSCFFile

        public void loadSCFFile(int inputType)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        org.biojava.bio.chromatogram.UnsupportedChromatogramFormatException,
                        BadTraceException,
                        BadCommentException

        loads a trace file into memory.

        This method should be called with inputType 1. If the object was constructed with a known chromatogram it will use that chromatogram to derive this object's internal values from
        Parameters:
        inputType - the input trace type code
        Throws:
        org.biojava.bio.chromatogram.UnsupportedChromatogramFormatException - specific exception
        java.io.IOException - if any other miseclleaneous exceptions
        BadTraceException
        BadCommentException

                                                    BadTraceException,
                                                    BadCommentException
        method to convert (Mobilities, Baseline etc) the curent Trace Chromatogram
        Returns:
        Returns a ABIFChromatogramExtender object with updated channels
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        BadTraceException
        BadCommentException

      • baseline

            int traceLim1,
            int traceLim2)
        performs a baselining of a specified Channel
        Parameters:
        traceIndex - index of Channel to baseline
        traceLim1 - start index of Channel to baseline
        traceLim2 - end index of Channel to baseline

      • getbaselineLimit1

        public int getbaselineLimit1()
        derives a usefull lower limit index for baselining. Note Only to be used for Heteroduplex type traces
        Returns:
        the lower limit to use for baselining

      • getbaselineLimit2

        public int getbaselineLimit2()
        derives a usefull upper limit index for baselining. Note Only to be used for Heteroduplex type traces
        Returns:
        the upper limit to use for baselining

      • getChromatogram

        public org.biojava.bio.chromatogram.Chromatogram getChromatogram()

      • useChromatogram

        public boolean useChromatogram()
        Checks the internal objects chromatogram and file_position_from_root for null values and returns a boolean indicating if it is possible to use the chromatogram object or not
        Returns:
        Indicates if you should use the internal Chromatogram object or you should retrieve the chromatogram from #getFilePositionFromRoot()
